newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian development secretary to go to Congo.
newsitem.headline: Belgian development secretary to go to Congo.

text.p: Belgium's secretary of state for development aid, Reginald Moreels, will go to the Democratic Republic of Congo on June 17 for a four-day visit to attend a reconstruction conference, Belgian radio said on Saturday.
Other participants at the conference on rebuilding the war-torn central African country will be local unions, human rights organisations and the new government, BRTN said.
Observers from the United Nations, the European Union and South Africa are also expected.
Moreels would use the opportunity to raise the issue of refugees with the government of Laurent Kabila, which took office in May after overthrowing President Mobutu Sese Seko, the radio said.
There is international concern about the plight of Hutu refugees, amid allegations of massacres in areas controlled by Kabila's forces.
Over a million refugees fled neighbouring Rwanda fearing reprisals in 1994 after Hutu hardliners slaughtered hundreds of thousands of minority Tutsis.
Kabila's main allies are Tutsis from Rwanda and the refugees include many civilians but also fighters of Rwanda's former Hutu army who were blamed for the genocide.
